_comment: Improved JSON structure for better data organization and machine-readability.

history.summary: A World War I fighter squadron of the Luftstreitkräfte, credited with 108 aerial victories. It became a highly mobile 'fire brigade' unit in 1918, supporting various armies before demobilizing at the end of the war.

formation.context: Formed from personnel of the Fokkerstaffel attached to FFA 9 and other units in the Armee-Abteilung C sector.

notableEvents.event: Scored the squadron's first aerial victory.
Joined Jagdgruppe von Braun, a temporary fighter group.
Joined Jagdgeschwader II, alongside Jasta 12, Jasta 15, and Jasta 19.
Became a 'fire brigade' unit, moving frequently to support different armies (18th, 1st, 2nd, 3rd, 5th Armee).
Moved to its last base at Trier, the day before the Armistice.

commanders.name: Eduard Ritter von Dostler
commanders.note: Notable ace, winner of the Pour le Mérite and a knighthood.

commanders.name: Guttler
commanders.note: Notable ace, decorated for his services.

commanders.name: Thomas
commanders.note: Notable ace, decorated for his services.

commanders.name: Franz Buchner
commanders.note: Notable ace, credited with 40 victories for the squadron.

notablePilots.name: Hans Martin Pippart
notablePilots.note: Prewar veteran and prominent balloon buster ace.

source.comment: Original source path was an absolute path, changed to a relative one for portability.
